queries: According to some informants the modern form of this sign is now performed from the tip of the nose to the forehead.
nominalLexeme: 1. An outing at which people eat a meal out of doors, usually in a field, wood, park, or at the beach. English = picnic.
oldEntry: Popular explanation: the outline of a cyst on the forehead of a grocer who used to take deaf children from Darlington school on picnics.
